intro: Geranium pingue, commonly known as the sticky geranium, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that produce a sticky substance, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of red, pink, and purple, typically blooming in summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its adaptability and ornamental value make it a valued addition to many gardens.
